Find the value of the base $b$ such that the following addition problem is correct: $$ \begin{array}{@{}c@{\;}c@{}c@{}c@{}c@{}c} & & 6 & 6 & 5 & 1_b \\ + & & & 1 & 1 & 5_b \\ \cline{1-6} & 1 & 0 & 0 & 6 & 6_b\\ \end{array} $$
ground_truth: In the two rightmost columns of addition, there is no carrying, but in the third, there is, so $6_b + 1_b = 10_b$ and $b = \boxed{7}.$

question:
$6+1 = 10 \implies 6+1_b = 10_b$ so $6_b + 1_b = 10_b$, $b>6$
$5+5 = 10 \implies 5_b + 5_b = 10_b$, $2 \times 5_b = 10_b$
$5_b + 5_b = 10_b \implies 5_b = 5$, $5_b + 5_b = 10$, $5 \times 2 = 10$.

$6_b + 1_b = 10_b \implies 6 + 1 = 10 \implies 7 = 10 \implies 10 = 1 \times b^1 + 0 \times b^0 = b$
$5+5=10$ so $5_b + 5_b = 10 \implies 2 \times 5 = 10$. If $b=7$, then $6+1 = 7 = 10$, and $5+5 = 10$. In base 7, $6+1=7$. In base 7, $10_7 = 7_10$.
$5+5 = 10 = 7 + 3 = 1 \times 7^1 + 3 \times 7^0 = 13$
In base 7, $5+5=10$, so $2 \times 5 = 10$. This corresponds to $5+5=10$, so $2 \times 5 = 10$ implies $10_7=7$, so $5_b=5$,
$5_b + 5_b = 10_b$, $5+5=10 \implies 10 = 1 \times b^1 + 0 \times b^0 = b$.
Column 1: $6_b+?=0_b$, but since $10_b=b$, then $6+1=7 \implies 6_7+1_7=7_7 = 10_7$. Also $5+5=10=7+3 = 13$.
Column 2: $6+1=7 \implies 7=10$.
$6_b + 1_b = (6+1)_b = (7)_b$, but this should equal $(10)_b = b$.
$5+5=10 \implies 10_b=b$.
$6_b+1_b=10_b$, $5_b+5_b=10_b$.
$6_b+1_b=b$. $6+1=7$. $5_b+5_b=(2 \times 5)_b=10_b = b$ so $2 \times 5_b=b$.
$6_b + 1_b = 7 = b$, $5_b + 5_b = 10_b = b$. $2\times 5_b = b$, $2\times 5 = 10$, so $5 = 5$. $5+5=10$. So $2 \times 5=10$.
If $b = 7$, then $6_7+1_7=7_7=10_7$, $5_7+5_7=10_7$. $6_7+1_7=7_7 = 10_7 = 7$.
If $b = 7$, then $2\times 5_7=10_7 = b = 7$. $2 \times 5 = 10$.
Final Answer: $\boxed{7}$

inference:
If $b > 6$, we have $6_b + 1_b = 10_b$.  This means $6+1 = b$, so $b = 7$.

Also, $5_b + 5_b = 10_b$.  This means $2 \times 5 = b$, so $b = 10$. But $b$ must be greater than 6. Since $b=7$, we get $6_7 + 1_7 = 7_7 = 7$, and $5_7+5_7 = 10_7 = 7$, which is consistent.

Thus, $b=7$.

Final Answer: $\boxed{7}$
ground_truth: In the two rightmost columns of addition, there is no carrying, but in the third, there is, so $6_b + 1_b = 10_b$ and $b = \boxed{7}.$
